Section.Name: Common
Section.Comment: Text that may be used by all scripts.

Section.Name: Main
Section.Comment: Text used by main.php and its includes (main_*.inc.php).

Section.Name: No Events Found Messages
Section.Item: 'No events were found for this day.'

Section.Name: Event View
Section.Item: 'copy this event into your personal desktop calendar'

Section.Name: Filter View
Section.Item: 'Select the event categories you would like events displayed for:'

Section.Name: Subscribe View
Section.Item:
'If you have a desktop calendar or PDA compatible with the iCalendar standard you can subscribe to a calendar or download events. Currently the iCalendar standard is fully supported by Apple\'s iCal, and the Mozilla Calendar.

If your calendar software cannot subscribe to a whole category of events, you should still be able to download individual events by clicking on the link "copy this event into your personal desktop calendar" which you will find on each page that lists event details.'

Section.Name: Export View
Section.Item: 'Export events to a file you can save on your computer as a backup, or to transfer to another calendar.'

'Some errors were found with the information you submited.
Scroll down to view the errors.'
' or keep scrolling down for more HTML settings.'

'This format can be used to backup (and later restore) your events.
For a detailed description of this format see the VTCalendar Web site.'
'The event ID specified is not in the valid format.'
'To avoid excessively large output, you can specify the maximum number of events.'
'You must enter a number between 1 and ' . MAX_EXPORT_EVENTS . '.'
'Must be a number from 1 to ' . MAX_EXPORT_EVENTS
'The start and end date for which you want events.'

'Leave blank for no start date, enter a date in YYYY-MM-DD format,
enter "today" to use today\'s date, or enter "upcoming" to only show upcoming events.'
'You must either a "From" date in yyyy-mm-dd format, leave it blank for no "From" date, enter "today" to use today\'s date, or enter "upcoming" to only show upcoming events.'

'Leave blank for no end date, enter a date in YYYY-MM-DD format,
or enter a number to represent the number of days after the "From" date.'
'You must a "To" date in yyyy-mm-dd format, leave it blank for no "To" date, or enter a number to represent the number of days after the "From" date.'
'If you enter a "To" date you must also enter a "From" date.'
'Choose the event categories you would like to export events for'
'You must select one or more categories.'
'Note: The number in parenthesis is the database ID for the category, which is used in the VTCalendar (XML) format.'
'case-insensitive substring search, e.g. school of the arts'
'You must either select "All sponsors" or enter the specific sponsor to search for.'

'When events are clicked, and users go to the full VTCalendar screen, the category filter is not maintained. Check the box below if you would like to pass the category filter to VTCalendar so the day, week, month, etc. views are also filtered. This will be ignored if you did selected "All categories" in the previous section.'
'For the HTML export formats (including HTML via JavaScript), the output can either be a series of paragraphs or rows in a single table.'
'Wrap the HTML in document.write calls so that it can be displayed easily on other pages.'
'The time can only display the starting time, display the start and end time, or display the start time and how long the event will last (aka: duration).'
'You can change how much information is included when a time is displayed (this effects both start and end times).'

'You may show or hide the date and time in the returned events.
This can be done if you have a limited amount of space on your web site.
 
Note: It is recommended to show the date and time.'

'You may show or hide the location in the returned events.
This can be done if you have a limited amount of space on your web site.'

'If an event is all day (aka: it does not have a start time) you may show or hide the "All Day" text.
This helps to keep the event listing clean if you have a lot of events that are all day.
 
Note: It is recommended to show "All Day".'

'If you have a limited amount of space on your Web site, you may limit the length of the event title.
Any titles that are beyond this length will be truncated and an ellipse (...) will be added to the end.'
'You must enter either a number below or leave it blank.'

'If you have a limited amount of space on your Web site, you may limit the length of the event location.
Any locations that are beyond this length will be truncated and an ellipse (...) will be added to the end.'
'You must enter either a number below or leave it blank.'
'To save the exported events, right-click this link (CTRL-click on a Mac) and select "Save Target As..." or "Save Link As..."'
'The URL below will export events based on the settings you provided.'
'The HTML code below can be copy/pasted into your Web site to automatically load event data or display events based on the settings you provided.'
'The window below shows the raw output for the exported events.'

Section.Name: Export Help
Section.Item:
'You can export all or a subset of the data of the event calendar in two different ways:
  • by choosing the link "export events" in the sponsor\'s options menu
  • or by directly accessing the export URL
    e.g. '

'

Currently the calendar supports the following export formats:

  • XML (custom XML; for format see below) (type=xml)
  • iCalendar/vCalendar (type=ical)
  • RSS 0.91 (type=rss)
  • RSS 1.0 (type=rss1_0)
  • VoiceXML 2.0 (type=vxml)
'

Section.Name: Database Errors
Section.Item: 'Error: The calendar does not seem to have any sponsors.'

Section.Name: Update
Section.Comment: Text used by the login-protected interface

Section.Name: Misc

Item.Name: login_failed_include
Item.Comment: Displayed when CUSTOM_LOGIN_HTML is true but the custom login file could not be read.

Section.Item: 'Warning: Failed to read static-includes/loginform.txt. Check that file exists and permissions are set correctly.'
'Note: The sponsor marked with a ** is the administrative sponsor of this calendar'
'"The URL is invalid. Please make sure that you enter: "http://" in front."'

Item.Name: default_sponsor_name
Item.Comment: The default sponsor name when a new calendar is created.

Item.Name: default_category_name
Item.Comment: The default category name when a new calendar is created.

Section.Name: Login Screen
Section.Item: 'You are currently not authorized to update the calendar because you have not been assigned to an event sponsor.'
'You do not belong to the sponsor that you selected. Please select a sponsor from the list below.'

Section.Name: Update Main Menu
Section.Item: 'Add a new event to the calendar.'
'View events that have been submitted, and see if they have been approved.'
'Create templates to easily add new events with similar information.'
'Export events to a file you can save on your computer as a backup, or to transfer to another calendar.'
'Import an XML file that contains events as a batch.'
'Change the default homepage address that appears when adding new events.'
'Change the default e-mail that appears when adding new events.'
'Change the password you use when logging in to the calendar.'
'Approve, edit or deny events that have been submitted by sponsors for this calendar.'
'Sponsors are groups of users who submit under a common name, such as "Chess Club".'
'Automatically remove sponsors who have not submitted events in a specific amount of time.'
'Change the header and footer HTML, as well as basic colors in the calendar. You can also change whether or not the calendar requires authentication for viewing the events.'
'Change the calendar colors to match your web site\'s design.'
'Categories are used when a person wants to filter events on the calendar. All events must be assigned to one category.'
'When a "Featured keyword" is used in a search, a message automatically appears at the top of the search results.'
'You can view a log of all the keywords searched here, which can be useful when you want to create keyword synonyms or featured keywords.'
'Add, edit and remove user accounts from the database.'
'Add, edit and remove calendars as well as set who has \'administrative\' access to the calendar.'
'Add, edit and remove users who have full access to the entire calendar system.'
'The following are external links to various VTCalendar resources'

Section.Name: Notices
Section.Comment: These appear on update.php after actions have been successfully completed (e.g. submitted new event).
Section.Item: 'The new event has been submitted for approval:'
'The update for the event has been submitted for approval:'
'The address of your homepage was successfully changed to:'
'Your email address was successfully changed to:'

Section.Name: Reocurring Event
Section.Item: '(The recurrence you have defined produces no dates!)'

Section.Name: Event Date & Time
Section.Item:
'Choose between one of the radio buttons to determine whether your event is a one-time or a recurring event. Then you will be given the opportunity to specify the date of the one-time event or define the recurrence for a repeating event.
The validity of the date you picked is checked after pressing the "Preview Event" button.'

'Declare the event as being an "all day event" (for example "Thanksgiving Day") or specify start and ending time for the event. Pick "???" for the hour of the ending time if the event does not have a specified ending time.'
'The ending date must be equal or greater than the starting date.'
'Please specify "All day event" or a starting time.'
'Warning! Ending time is not greater than starting time.'
'Warning! The ending time is not specified.'

Section.Name: Basic Event Information
Section.Item: 'The category that best fits your event. This facilitates searching.'
'A short but descriptive title that is meaningful to the general audience.'

'A detailed description of the event. To avoid unnecessary calls or e-mails to your office be as detailed as possible.
You are not limited in space, and Web and e-mail addresses are automatically linked.'

Section.Name: Additional Event Information
Section.Item: 'Optionally describe the location of the event (e.g. Squires Colonial Hall Room 200.)'
'A charge for taking part in the event. If it\'s free then leave the field blank.'
'Optionally specify the name of a person that can be contacted by people interested to learn more about the event.'

'Optionally specify a phone number that a person can call for further information.
If you include more than one number, make sure to specify what each number is for (e.g. phone, fax).'
'Optionally specify an email address that can be used to request further information.'

Section.Name: Event Owner
Section.Item:
'This is the sponsor who owns this event in the calendar system.
The sponsor who owns this event is able to copy and delete it, as well as submit new versions for approval.'

Section.Name: Displayed Sponsor/URL
Section.Item:
'This is information about the department or organization that is the official sponsor of the event.
For example, if this event was Commencement then the sponsor would be the Office of the Secretary.'

Section.Name: Submit to Default Calendar
Section.Item: 'Yes, and assign it to the following category'
'Submit this event for approval to be added to the "DEFAULTCALENDARNAME" calendar.'

Section.Name: Users
Section.Item: 'This user is already a main admin.'

Section.Name: Categories
Section.Item: 'This name already exist. Please choose a different one.'

Section.Name: Keywords
Section.Item:
'Do NOT add multiple words.
A keyword (or alternative keyword) cannot contain spaces.'

Section.Name: Approval Page
Section.Item: 'New events, and changes to existing events, must be approved before they are visible to the public. If an event is rejected, the sponsor who submitted the event is notified. The sponsor can then make any necessary changes and resubmit the event. Note: Sponors can delete their events at anytime without requiring approval.'
'Please login to the calendar, edit and re-submit your event.'
'There are no events currently awaiting approval.'

Section.Name: Add/Edit Sponsors
Section.Item: 'A sponsor with this name already exists. Please choose a different one.'

'Short instructions for adding an event: - Login using your personal user-ID and password - Click on "Add new event" - Fill in the fields - Press the "Preview event" button - If the preview looks ok, press the "Save changes" button Your event is submitted to the calendar administrator for review and will be publicized shortly. '

Section.Name: Manage Featured Search Keywords
Section.Item:
'Below you can associate certain search keywords with custom
text messages or HTML. This can be used to answer to keywords
which are frequently used but rarely have a match within the
calendar.'

Section.Name: Manage Alternate Search Keywords
Section.Item:
'The following list contains keywords which are tried by the calendar search engine
in addition to the keyword provided by the user. You can improve the search engine\'s
power by building a list of common synonyms (or alternative keywords) for
frequently-used keywords.'

Section.Name: Help Windows
Section.Comment: This is being phased out and the text is instead being included directly on pages
Section.Item: 'This is an example of the custom XML format:'
'The value for "categoryid" is one of the following index numbers:'

'

Authorization to add events can be obtained by contacting the calendar administrator at '

'

All event submissions will be reviewed by the calendar coordinator before they are posted. Consequently, it is important to submit items at least two days in advance of the event. During the review process, submissions will be checked to see if they are appropriate for posting and edited for clarity and conciseness.

'
